abstract: Johnson & Johnson will pay $480 million in cash for Micrus Endovascular, which makes catheters and other devices to treat stroke-related problems in the brain.
snippet: Johnson & Johnson will pay $480 million in cash for Micrus Endovascular, which makes catheters and other devices to treat stroke-related problems in the brain.
lead_paragraph: The market for medical devices used in the treatment of strokes is heating up.

headline.main: J.&J. Will Buy a Stroke-Treatment Company for $480 Million
headline.print_headline: J.&J. Will Buy a Stroke-Treatment Company for $480 Million
